sentences.cn: ...被释放的奴隶和他们的后代。

sentences.en: A cat's kittens are her progeny.
A major barrier to interspecific hybridization is sterility in the F 1 progeny.
sentences.cn: 种间杂交的主要障碍是F1代的不育性.

sentences.en: A radon progeny continuous monitor was developed.
sentences.cn: 本工作研制氡子体连续测量仪.

sentences.en: Among its many progeny, the 1944 Education Act gave birth to the modern youth service.
sentences.cn: 在1944年通过的《教育法案》的诸多衍生条款中，就包括了现代青年教育服务。

sentences.en: Davis was never loquacious on the subject of his progeny.
sentences.cn: 戴维斯说到他的子女时总是寡言少语。

sentences.en: He appeared, surrounded by his numerous progeny.
sentences.cn: 他出现时, 子女前呼后拥不计其数.

sentences.en: He was surrounded by his numerous progeny.
Her numerous progeny were all asleep.
Lastly, we sum up the research progeny, and indicate several problems needed to be solved.
sentences.cn: 最后, 给出了全文的研究结果总结, 指出了进一步改进设计的方向.

sentences.en: Parents, meanwhile, have a genetic incentive to see their progeny do well.
sentences.cn: 因此在贫困的环境下, 相比男性胚胎, 女性胚胎更有优势.
萨拉和她的一大群孩子

sentences.en: Set up real option pricing model based on ANN was the progeny of this paper.
sentences.cn: 本课题的研究成果是,建立了基于人工神经网络的实物期权定价模型.

sentences.en: The genetic attributes of the embryo and the genotype of its progeny are thus altered.
sentences.cn: 那么胚胎的遗传特性以及基因型也因此而改变了.

sentences.en: The progeny or descendants of a person, an animal, or a plant considered as a group.
sentences.cn: 后代人 、 动物或植物的子孙或后代(总称)

sentences.en: The progeny resembled one of the other of the parents.
sentences.cn: 后代象亲本的一方或另一方.

sentences.en: Their progeny is secure in their sight ; they see before them their kinsfolk and their offspring.
sentences.cn: 他们在世时, 子孙昌盛,亲眼看见子子孙孙.

trans.tran_en: the babies of animals or plants
